titleStmt.title: T. Holmes et al. to James F. Robinson
CWG7748

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, James F. Robinson: Appointments by the Governor, Civil Appointments, 1862-1863

body.p: To His Excellency the Governor of Ky

Your petitioners respectfully represent that there is a vacancy in the office of Justice of the Peace in & for the 2nd District in Hancock County occasioned by the resignation of John McBrown who was Elected and is now Presiding Judge of the Hancock County Court -- Now we respectfully recommend that Milton L. Cooper be Commissioned by Yr Excellency to fill the said vacancy. He is well qualified, and a consistent Union man. And would fill the office we think well. We are citizens of the said District and Union Men. --

T Holmes
Wm Dial
Ed Humfrey
G. W. McAdams
Wat Longest
Edw Davidson
Chas. B. Bell Sheriff Elected
